> Dhillon:
>
> FWIW, here's my list of "must-haves" when evaluating a pro=
gramming
> environment that aims to help developers work in the HTTP space:=

> - Request Dispatcher : routes HTTP requests to the proper code.
> - URI =
Handler : =A0parses the details of the URI (scheme, path, query info,
> etc=
.)
> - Mime Parser : handles the details of determining the media type
> in=
cluding support for conneg
> - Request Handler : target of the Request Disp=
atcher; the fun code goes
here
> - Transformer : converts stored data into =
the proper representation
> (and handles incoming representations, too)
> -=
 HTTP Client : a 'mini HTTP Client' that allows you to make requests
> to o=
ther HTTP servers
> - Caching : basic support for caching and conditional r=
equests
> - Authentication : understands various auth models
>
> I need all=
 these things when I'm coding for HTTP and the quality of
> support in any =
framework determines whether I enjoy or dread working
> with that library.
=
>
> mca
> http://amundsen.com/blog/
>
>
>
>
